Description: Written by Bertolt Brecht and directed by Fritz Lang, the film is loosely based on the 1942 assassination of Reinhard Heydrich, the Nazi Reich Protector of German-occupied Prague, number-two man in the SS, and a chief architect of the Holocaust, who was known as "The Hangman of Prague". Heydrick was assassinated by Czech resistance fighters parachuted from a British plane in Operation Anthropoid, but in the movie, which was made during World War II before the full story was public knowledge, Heydrich&#039;s killer is a member of the Czech resistance.
